do.eng_def: used instead of the main verb in questions that are added to the end of a sentence to check information
do.chi_def: （在用來確認資訊的疑問句中代替主要動詞）
do.eg: You met him at our party, didn't you?

do.eng_def: used instead of the main verb in questions that are added to the end of a sentence as a way of expressing surprise
do.chi_def: （在表示驚奇的疑問句中代替主要動詞）
do.eg: So Susannah and May finally got married, did they?

do.eng_def: used to avoid repeating a verb or verb phrase
do.chi_def: （用於避免動詞或動詞片語的重複）
do.eg: She runs much faster than he does.

do.eng_def: used to give extra force to the main verb
do.eg: "Can I buy stamps here?" "Well, we do sell them, but we don't have any at the moment."

do.eng_def: to perform, take part in, or achieve something
do.eg: That was a really stupid thing to do.

do.eng_def: to take action to deal with something
do.eg: It's a global problem - what can individuals do about it?

do.eng_def: to treat someone well or badly
to act or take action
do.eg: Stop arguing with me, Daryl, and do as you're told!

do.eng_def: connected with
do.eg: "Why did you want to talk to me?" "Well, it's to do with a complaint that's been made about your work."

do.eng_def: to deal with or be responsible for something
do.eg: Lucia is going to do the publicity for the school play.

do.eng_def: to study a subject
do.eg: Diane did anthropology at university.

do.eng_def: to solve or find the answer to something
do.eg: to do a puzzle

do.eng_def: to make, produce, or create something
do.eg: I can't go out tonight - I've got to do my history paper.

do.eng_def: If you say that you have done with something or someone, or have done performing a particular action, you mean that you have finished what you were doing with something or someone, or what you were saying to someone, or that you have finished the action.
do.eg: Have you done with those scissors yet?

do.eng_def: to clean something, or make something look neat and attractive
do.eg: I cooked the dinner so you can do (= wash) the dishes.

do.eng_def: to arrange something
do.eg: You've done those flowers beautifully.

do.eng_def: to travel a particular distance or to travel at a particular speed
do.chi_def: 行進過（一段路程）；以…速度行進
do.eg: It's an old car and it's done over 80,000 miles.

do.eng_def: to complete a journey
do.eg: We did the journey to Boston in five hours.

do.eng_def: to be acceptable, suitable, or enough
do.eg: Will this room do or would you prefer one with a shower?

do.eng_def: to provide or sell something, or to cause someone to have something
do.eg: They are doing a special offer - three for the price of two.

do.eng_def: to cook or prepare food
do.eg: Who's doing the food for your party?

do.eng_def: to develop or continue with the stated amount of success
do.chi_def: 進展；繼續保持；設法做到
do.eg: How is Mary doing in her new job/school?

do.eng_def: to perform a play or to play the part of a character
do.eg: The children are doing a play at the end of term.

do.eng_def: to visit the interesting places in a town or country, or to look around an interesting place
do.eg: We didn't get to do Nice when we were in France.

do.eng_def: to enter a building illegally and steal from it
do.eg: Our house was done while we were away.

do.eng_def: to cheat someone
do.eg: $50 for that old bike! You've been done!

do.eng_def: to spend time in prison
do.eg: He did three years for his part in the robbery.

do.eng_def: to punish someone
do.eg: If you mess with me again, I'll do you good and proper.

do.eng_def: to take an illegal drug
do.eg: How long have you been doing heroin?

do.eng_def: to be happening
do.eg: This town is so boring in the evening - there's never anything doing.

do.eng_def: a way of treating people
do.eg: There are no special privileges for the managers - we believe in fair dos all round (= equal treatment for everyone) in this company.

do.eng_def: a party or other social event
do.eg: Colin's having a bit of a do for his 50th birthday.

do.eng_def: a  hairdo old-fashioned
the first note of the sol-fa musical scale
do.chi_def: 哆（大調音階的第一個音）
do.eg: Would you sing me a do, please?

dock.eng_def: an area of water in a port that can be closed off and that is used for putting goods onto and taking them off ships or repairing ships
a group of these areas of water in a port and the buildings around them
dock.chi_def: 碼頭區（包括船塢及周圍建築）
dock.eg: The strike has led to the cancellation of some ferry services and left hundreds of passengers stranded at the docks.

dock.eng_def: a long structure built over water where passengers can get on or off a boat or where goods can be put on and taken off
the place in a criminal law court where the accused person sits or stands during the trial
dock.eg: The defendant seemed nervous as he left the dock and stepped up to the witness box.

dock.eng_def: a common wild plant with large wide leaves that grows in some northern countries such as Britain
dock.chi_def: 酸模（一種生長在如英國等北方國家的寬葉野生植物）
dock.eg: Rubbing dock leaves on nettle stings helps to relieve the pain.
As a punishment, the Army docked the soldiers' pay/wages by 20% and took away their leave.

dock.eng_def: If a ship docks, it arrives at a dock and if someone docks a ship, they bring it into a dock.
dock.eg: Hundreds of people turned up to see the ship dock at the pier.

doctor.eng_def: a person with a medical degree whose job is to treat people who are ill or hurt
the place where a doctor works
doctor.eg: He went to the doctor's this morning for a check-up.

doctor.eng_def: a person who has the highest degree (= qualification) from a college or university
to change a document in order to deceive people
doctor.eg: He was found to have provided the court with doctored evidence.

doctor.eng_def: to secretly put a harmful or poisonous substance into food or drink
doctor.eg: Bottles of lemonade doctored with rat poison were discovered in the kitchen.

doctor.eng_def: to remove the sexual organs of an animal in order to prevent it from producing young

doctrine.eng_def: a belief or set of beliefs, especially political or religious ones, that are taught and accepted by a particular group
doctrine.chi_def: （尤指政治或宗教的）信條，教義，學說

document.eng_def: a paper or set of papers with written or printed information, especially of an official type
a text that is written and stored on a computer
document.eg: I'll send you the document by email.

document.eng_def: to record the details of an event, a process, etc.
document.eg: His interest in cars has been well-documented (= recorded and written about) by the media.

documentary.eng_def: a film or television or radio programme that gives facts and information about a subject
documentary.chi_def: （電影或電視）紀錄片；紀實性廣播節目
documentary.eg: The documentary took a fresh look at the life of Darwin.
Human rights campaigners have discovered documentary evidence of torture.

documentary.eng_def: giving facts and information about a subject in the form of a film or television or radio programme
documentary.chi_def: （電影、電視、廣播節目等的）紀實的，記錄的
documentary.eg: Most of her movies have a documentary style.

dodge.eng_def: to avoid being hit by something by moving quickly to one side
dodge.eg: He dodged to avoid the hurtling bicycle.
The Senator dodged questions about his relationship with the actress.

dodge.eng_def: a clever, dishonest way of avoiding something
dodge.eg: They bought another car as a tax dodge (= a way to avoid paying tax).

dog.eng_def: a common animal with four legs, especially kept by people as a pet or to hunt or guard things
dog.chi_def: （尤指當作寵物或用來打獵、看護的）狗，犬

dog.eng_def: a man who is unpleasant or not to be trusted
dog.chi_def: 討厭的傢夥，惹人煩的傢夥；失信者
dog.eg: He tried to steal my money, the dirty dog.

dog.eng_def: a woman who is not attractive
to follow someone closely and continuously

dog.eg: Technical problems dogged our trip from the outset.

doll.eng_def: a child's toy in the shape of a small person or baby

dollar.eng_def: the standard unit of money used in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and other countries
dollar.chi_def: （美國、加拿大、澳大利亞、紐西蘭等國的貨幣單位）元

dollar.eng_def: the value of the US dollar, used in comparing the values of different types of money from around the world
dollar.chi_def: 美元幣值（用於與其他國家貨幣幣值作比較時）
dollar.eg: In the financial markets today, the dollar rose against/fell against (= was worth more than/less than) the pound.

dolphin.eng_def: a sea mammal that is large, smooth, and grey, with a long, pointed mouth

dome.eng_def: a rounded roof on a building or a room, or a building with such a roof
a shape like one-half of a ball
dome.eg: Gerald had a long grey beard and a shiny bald dome (= head).

domestic.eng_def: relating to a person's own country
belonging or relating to the home, house, or family
someone paid to do work, such as cleaning and cooking, in someone else's house

dominant.eng_def: more important, strong, or noticeable than anything else of the same type
dominant.chi_def: 主要的；主導的；佔優勢的

dominant.eng_def: A dominant gene is one that always produces a particular characteristic in a person, plant, or animal.
dominant.eg: The gene for brown eyes is dominant.

dominate.eng_def: to have control over a place or person
dominate.eg: He refuses to let others speak and dominates every meeting.

dominate.eng_def: to be the largest, most important, or most noticeable part of something
dominate.chi_def: 在…中占首要地位；擁有優勢；最明顯的
dominate.eg: The cathedral dominates the landscape for miles around.

donate.eng_def: to give money or goods to help a person or organization
donate.eg: An anonymous businesswoman donated one million dollars to the charity.

donate.eng_def: to allow some of your blood or a part of your body to be used for medical purposes
donate.eg: The appeal for people to donate blood was very successful.

donation.eng_def: money or goods that are given to help a person or organization, or the act of giving them

donkey.eng_def: an animal like a small horse with long ears

donor.eng_def: a person who gives some of their blood or a part of their body to help someone who is ill
a person who gives money or goods to an organization
donor.eg: Thanks to a large gift from an anonymous donor, the charity was able to continue its work.

doom.eng_def: death, destruction, or any very bad situation that cannot be avoided
doom.eg: A sense of doom hung over the entire country.

doom.eng_def: to make someone or something certain to do or experience something unpleasant, or to make something bad certain to happen
doom.eg: Are we doomed to repeat the mistakes of the past?

door.eng_def: a flat object that is used to close the entrance of something such as a room or building, or the entrance itself
to work at the entrance of a building, collecting tickets or preventing particular people from entering
used to refer to a house or other building
door.eg: Sam only lives a few doors (away/up/down) from us.

doorstep.eng_def: a step in front of an outside door
doorstep.eg: He left the package on the doorstep.

doorstep.eng_def: a very thick piece of bread
If you are doorstepped by journalists, they come to your house and ask you to speak or answer questions, even if you do not want them to.
doorstep.eg: He complained about being doorstepped by the press.

doorstep.eng_def: to go to every house in a particular area selling something or asking for support
doorstep.chi_def: 挨家挨戶兜售（募捐、拉選票等）

doorway.eng_def: the space in a wall where a door opens, or a covered area just outside a door

dorm.eng_def: a large room containing many beds, for example in a boarding school
dorm.chi_def: （尤指寄宿學校或大學的）宿舍

dorm.eng_def: a large building at a college or university where students live
dorm.eg: Smoking is not permitted in college dorms.

dormitory.eng_def: a large room containing many beds, for example in a boarding school
a large building at a college or university where students live

dosage.eng_def: the amount of medicine that you should take at one time
dosage.eg: "What's the dosage?" "One spoonful three times a day."

dose.eng_def: a measured amount of something such as medicine
an amount or experience of something, often something bad or unpleasant
dose.chi_def: 一些（糟糕或不愉快的事）
dose.eg: The government received a hefty dose of bad news this week.

dose.eng_def: a case of gonorrhoea (= a disease of the sexual organs)
to give someone a measured amount of medicine
dose.eg: He dosed himself (up) with valium to calm his nerves.

dot.eg: The full stop at the end of this sentence is a dot.

dot.eng_def: the spoken form of a full stop in an internet or email address, or some computer files
dot.chi_def: （網際網路、電子郵件位址或某些電腦檔所使用的句號的口語形式）點
dot.eg: "What's the web address?" "www dot cambridge dot org".

dot.eng_def: the short sounds or short flashes of light used with dashes when sending messages in Morse (code)
to put a dot or dots on something
dot.eg: Your handwriting is hard to read because you don't dot your i's.

dot.eng_def: to be spread across an area, or to spread many similar things across an area
dot.eg: We have offices dotted around/all over the region.

double.eng_def: twice the size, amount, price, etc., or consisting of two similar things together
double.eg: I ordered a double espresso (= two standard amounts in one cup).

double.eng_def: A double flower or plant is a flower with more than the usual number of petals.
a person who looks exactly the same as someone else
double.chi_def: 一模一樣的人；極相像的人
double.eg: Hey, Tony, I met someone at a party last week who was your double.

double.eng_def: a game of tennis or a similar sport between two teams of two people
an occasion when a football team wins two major competitions in a single season
double.chi_def: （足球比賽）雙料冠軍（即在同一賽季贏得兩項重要比賽的冠軍頭銜）
double.eg: Which was the first team to do the double in English football?

double.eng_def: in baseball, a hit that allows the batter (= person who hits the ball) to reach second base
to become twice as much or as many, or to make something twice as much or many
double.eg: The government aims to double the number of students in higher education within 25 years.

double.eng_def: something that is twice the amount, size, strength, etc. of something else
double.eg: I paid double (= twice as much) for those trousers last week.
Fold the blanket double (= so that it is in two layers) and then you won't be cold.

double.eng_def: to have a problem with your eyes so that you see two of everything, usually because you are drunk or ill
double.chi_def: （通常指因醉酒或疾病導致視力）出現重影
double.eg: I started seeing double, then I fainted.

doubt.eng_def: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
doubt.chi_def: （尤指對好壞、真實性的）懷疑，疑慮，疑問
doubt.eg: I'm having doubts about his ability to do the job.

doubt.eng_def: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true or likely to happen
doubt.chi_def: 毫無疑問，毋庸置疑，肯定
doubt.eg: We will, no doubt, discuss these issues again at the next meeting.

doubt.chi_def: 對…懷有疑慮，對…表示懷疑
doubt.eg: Witnesses have cast doubt on the accused's innocence.

doubt.eng_def: If the future or success of someone or something is in doubt, it is unlikely to continue or to be successful.
doubt.eg: The future of the stadium is in doubt because of a lack of money.
She is without (a) doubt the best student I have ever taught.

doubt.eng_def: to not feel certain or confident about something or to think that something is not probable
doubt.eg: I doubt whether/if I can finish the work on time.

doubt.eng_def: to not trust someone or believe what they say
doubt.chi_def: 不相信，不信任，懷疑（某人／某人的話）
doubt.eg: He's never lied to me before, so I have no reason to doubt his word.

doubtful.eng_def: If you are doubtful about something, you are uncertain about it.
doubtful.chi_def: 懷疑的，有疑慮的；不能確定的
doubtful.eg: The teacher is doubtful about having parents working as classroom assistants.

doubtful.eng_def: If a situation is doubtful, it is unlikely to happen or to be successful.
doubtful.eg: It is doubtful whether/if they ever reached the summit before they died.

dough.eng_def: flour mixed with water and often yeast, fat, or sugar, so that it is ready for baking

dough.eg: I don't want to work but I need the dough.

doughnut.eng_def: a small, circular cake, fried in hot fat, either with a hole in the middle or filled with jam
doughnut.chi_def: 炸麵包圈；炸果醬麵包；甜甜圈

dove.eng_def: a white or grey bird, often used as a symbol of peace
a person in politics who prefers to solve problems using peaceful methods instead of force or violence

down.eng_def: in or towards a low or lower position, from a higher one
down.eg: Is this lift going down?

down.eng_def: moving from above and onto a surface
down.eg: Just as I was sitting down to watch TV, the phone rang.

down.eng_def: firmly in place or into position
down.eg: I put the loose floorboard back and nailed it down.

down.eng_def: in or towards a lower level, a smaller amount, or a simpler state
down.chi_def: （水平等）由高到低地；（数量等）由大到小地；（情况等）由复杂变简单地
down.eg: The rate of inflation is finally going down.

down.eng_def: If you burn, cut, or knock something or someone down, you cause it, him, or her to fall to the ground, usually damaged, destroyed, or injured.
down.eg: The house burned down many years ago.

down.eng_def: in writing or on paper
down.eg: I'll write it down now so I won't forget.

down.eng_def: used, especially with prepositions, to emphasize that a place is at some distance from you or from somewhere considered to be central
down.eg: I'll meet you down at the gym after work.

down.eng_def: in or towards the south
down.eg: It's much warmer down (in the) south.

down.eng_def: from an older person to a younger one
down.chi_def: 傳下去（地），傳給下一代（地）
down.eg: The necklace has been passed/handed down through seven generations.

down.eng_def: inside your stomach
down.eg: You'll feel better once you've got some hot soup down you.

down.eng_def: at the time of buying
down.eg: I gave him $1,000 down, and paid the rest in instalments.

down.eng_def: in or towards a low or lower position, from a higher one
down.eg: I slid down the hill.

down.eng_def: along
down.eg: We drove down the highway as far as Atlanta.

down.eng_def: to
down.eg: I went down the pub with my mates.

down.eng_def: to cause something or someone to fall to the ground
down.eg: We downed three enemy planes with our missiles.

down.eng_def: to eat or drink something quickly
down.chi_def: 一口氣吃下；一口氣喝下
down.eg: He'd downed four beers before I'd finished one.

down.eng_def: to defeat someone, especially in sport
down.chi_def: （尤指在比賽中）打敗，擊敗，戰勝
down.eg: The Yankees downed the Red Sox 7–0.

down.eng_def: unhappy; unable to feel excited or energetic about anything
down.chi_def: 不高興的；情緒低落的，提不起精神的
down.eg: She's been really down since her husband left.

down.eng_def: (of a system or machine, especially a computer) not in operation or not working, usually only for a limited period of time
down.chi_def: （尤指電腦等機器或系統）停止運作
down.eg: The network will be down for an hour for routine maintenance.

down.eng_def: small soft feathers, especially those from a young bird
down.eg: goose/duck down

down.eng_def: very soft thin hair
to dislike someone, often unfairly
down.eg: Why do you have a down on him? I think he seems really nice.

down.eng_def: at or towards the end or the lower or worse part
down.eg: downhill

download.eng_def: to copy or move programs or information into a computer's memory, especially from the internet or a larger computer
download.chi_def: （尤指從網際網路或較大型電腦上）下載

download.eng_def: a computer program or information that has been or can be copied into a computer's memory
the act or process of copying programs or information into a computer's memory
download.eg: All of our products are available for download on our website.

downstairs.eng_def: to or on a lower floor of a building, especially the ground floor
downstairs.chi_def: 朝樓下，在樓下（尤指底層）
downstairs.eg: I went downstairs to answer the phone.

downtown.eng_def: in or to the central part of a city
downtown.chi_def: 在市中心（的）；朝市中心（的）

downwards.eg: The road slopes gently downwards for a mile or two.

doze.eng_def: to have a short sleep, especially during the day
doze.eg: My cat likes dozing in front of the fire.

draft.eng_def: a piece of text, a formal suggestion, or a drawing in its original state, often containing the main ideas and intentions but not the developed form
draft.eg: This is only a rough draft - the finished article will have pictures too.

draft.eng_def: the system of ordering people by law to join the armed forces
draft.eg: He avoided the draft because of a foot injury.

draft.eng_def: the system by which sports teams in the US choose new young players at the beginning of each season
draft.chi_def: （美國職業球隊在賽季之初選拔新隊員的）選秀制度

draft.eng_def: a written order for money to be paid by a bank, especially to another bank
draft.eg: I arranged for some money to be sent from London to L.A. by banker's draft.

draft.eng_def: a current of unpleasantly cold air blowing through a room
the depth of water needed for a boat to be able to float
a system of storing and serving drinks from large containers, especially barrels
draft.eg: Is the lager on draft or is it bottled?

draft.eng_def: (of drinks such as beer) stored in and served from large containers, especially barrels
(of animals) used for pulling heavy loads, vehicles, etc.
to write down a document for the first time, including the main points but not all the details
draft.eg: Draft a proposal for the project and we can discuss it at the meeting.

draft.eng_def: to draw the plans for a new building, structure, machine, etc.
draft.eg: They hired an architect to draft the plans for their new home.

draft.eng_def: to order people by law to join the armed forces
draft.eg: He was drafted (into the army) at 18.

draft.eng_def: A draft plan, document, etc. is in its first form, including the main points but not all the details.
(of drinks such as beer) stored in and served from large containers, especially barrels
(of animals) used for pulling heavy loads, vehicles, etc.

drag.eng_def: to move something by pulling it along a surface, usually the ground
drag.eg: Pick the chair up instead of dragging it behind you!

drag.eng_def: to make someone go somewhere they do not want to go
drag.eg: She had to drag her kids away from the toys.

drag.eng_def: to move something on a computer screen using a mouse
If you drag a subject into a conversation, etc., you begin to talk about it even if it is not connected with what you are talking about.
drag.chi_def: 插入（話題），把…扯進（談話中）
drag.eg: She's always dragging sex into the conversation.

drag.eng_def: to pull nets or hooks (= curved wires) along the bottom of a river or lake in order to find something
drag.eg: They found the man's body after dragging the canal.

drag.eng_def: If you drag and drop something on a computer screen, you move it from one area to another using the mouse.
If something such as a film or performance drags, it seems to go slowly because it is boring.
drag.chi_def: （電影或表演等）枯燥；拖拖拉拉
drag.eg: The first half of the movie was interesting but the second half dragged (on).

drag.eng_def: something that is not convenient and is boring or unpleasant
drag.eg: Filling in forms is such a drag!

drag.eng_def: the force that acts against the forward movement of something that is passing through a gas or a liquid
drag.eg: Engineers are always looking for ways to minimize drag when they design new aircraft.

drag.eng_def: the action of taking in air through a cigarette
drag.eg: Taking a deep drag of/on his cigarette he closed his eyes and sighed.

drag.eng_def: the activity of dressing in clothes of the opposite sex, especially of a man dressing in women's clothes, often for humorous entertainment
drag.chi_def: （尤指男人爲達到滑稽娛樂效果而）穿戴異性服裝

dragon.eng_def: a large, frightening imaginary animal, often represented with wings, a long tail, and fire coming out of its mouth
any of various types of large lizard

dragonfly.eng_def: a large insect with a long, thin, brightly coloured body and two pairs of transparent wings

drain.eng_def: If you drain something, you remove the liquid from it, usually by pouring it away or allowing it to flow away, and if something drains, liquid flows away or out of it.
If you drain a glass or cup, you drink all the liquid in it.

drain.eg: The long journey completely drained me.

drain.eng_def: to reduce or cause something to reduce
drain.eg: The long war had drained the resources of both countries.

drain.eng_def: If the blood/colour drains from your face, or if your face drains (of blood/colour), you turn very pale, often because you are shocked or ill.
drain.chi_def: （通常指因驚嚇或疾病而臉色）變蒼白
drain.eg: The colour drained from his face/cheeks when they told him the results.

drain.eng_def: a pipe or channel that is used to carry away waste matter and water from a building, or an opening in the road that rain water can flow down
drain.eg: I think the kitchen drain is blocked.

drain.eng_def: the system of pipes, openings in the ground, or other devices that are used for carrying away waste matter and water
drain.eg: There was an unpleasant smell coming from the drains.

drain.eng_def: a hole in a bath, sink, etc. through which water flows away and into which you can put a plug
something that makes you feel very tired
drain.eg: I think taking care of her elderly mother is a big drain on her energy.

drain.eng_def: something that uses more of your energy, money, or time than you want to give
drain.eg: Having a big mortgage is a real drain on your earnings.

drama.eng_def: a play in a theatre or on television or radio, or plays and acting generally
drama.eg: She's starred in several TV dramas.

drama.eng_def: used in expressions that refer to the type of play or film
an event or situation, especially an unexpected one, in which there is worry or excitement and usually a lot of action
drama.chi_def: （尤指突然的）戲劇性場面，戲劇性事件
drama.eg: We had a little drama last night when the oil in the pan caught fire.

drama.eng_def: the excitement and energy that is created by a lot of action and arguments
drama.eg: As a lawyer, he enjoyed the drama of the courtroom.

dramatic.eng_def: very sudden or noticeable, or full of action and excitement
dramatic.chi_def: 驟然的；戲劇性的；激動人心的

dramatic.eg: She bought me the complete dramatic works (= texts to be performed) of Brecht for my birthday.

drape.eng_def: to put something such as cloth or a piece of clothing loosely over something
drape.eg: He draped his jacket over the back of the chair and sat down to eat.

drape.eng_def: to be loosely covered with a cloth
drape.eg: The coffins were all draped with the national flag.

drape.eng_def: the way in which cloth folds or hangs as it covers something
drape.chi_def: （布料掛起來或折疊後）下垂的樣子
drape.eg: She liked the heavy drape of velvet.

drape.eng_def: heavy curtains made with thick cloth

drastic.eng_def: (especially of actions) severe and sudden or having very noticeable effects
drastic.chi_def: （尤指行動）嚴厲的，猛烈的，激烈的

draw.eng_def: to make a picture of something or someone with a pencil or pen
draw.eg: Jonathan can draw very well.

draw.eng_def: to attract attention or interest
draw.eg: He's an excellent speaker who always draws a crowd.

draw.eng_def: to attract someone's attention
draw.eg: Her eyes were immediately drawn to the tall blond man standing at the bar.

draw.eng_def: to make or show a comparison between things
draw.eg: You can't really draw a comparison between the two cases - they're completely different.

draw.eng_def: to consider the facts of a situation and make a decision about what is true, correct, likely to happen, etc.
draw.eg: I'd seen them together so often, I drew the logical conclusion that they were husband and wife.

draw.eng_def: to move in a particular direction, especially in a vehicle
draw.eg: The train slowly drew into the station/drew in.

draw.eng_def: to become nearer in space or time
draw.eg: As Christmas draws nearer, the big stores start to get unbearably crowded.

draw.eng_def: to gradually finish
draw.eg: As the evening drew to a close, people started reaching for their coats.

draw.eng_def: If something draws a reaction, people react in the stated way.
draw.eg: Her speech last night in the Senate drew an angry response.

draw.eng_def: to pull or direct something in a particular direction
draw.eg: She drew her coat tightly around her shoulders.

draw.eng_def: to pull curtains so that they are either together or apart
to choose a number, card, etc. from several numbers, cards, etc. without first seeing it, in a competition or a game
draw.eg: I was dealt two aces, and I drew a third.

draw.eng_def: to take something out of a container or your pocket, especially a weapon
draw.chi_def: 拿出，拔出，抽出（尤指武器）
draw.eg: Suddenly he drew a gun/knife and held it to my throat.

draw.eng_def: to cause a substance, especially blood, to come out of a body
draw.chi_def: 使（尤指血液）流出，使滲出
draw.eg: He bit me so hard that it drew blood.

draw.eng_def: to get a feeling, idea, etc. from something or someone
draw.eg: She drew comfort from the fact that he died peacefully.

draw.eng_def: to take air or smoke into your lungs
draw.eg: She drew a deep breath and plunged into the water.

draw.eng_def: to finish a game with the same number of points as the other person or team
draw.eg: Coventry drew 1–1 with United in the semifinal.

draw.eng_def: to get money from a bank, account, etc. so that you can use it
draw.eg: I drew some money out of my account to pay for our trip.

draw.eng_def: to receive money regularly, especially as an employee or from the government
draw.chi_def: （尤指從僱主或政府那裡）定期領取（一定數額的錢）
draw.eg: He's been drawing a pension for ten years.

draw.eng_def: someone or something that a lot of people are interested in
draw.eg: We need someone at the event who'll be a big draw and attract the paying public.

draw.eng_def: a situation in which each team in a game has equal points and neither side wins
draw.eg: The result was a draw.

draw.eng_def: a competition that is decided by choosing a particular ticket or number by chance

drawback.eng_def: a disadvantage or the negative part of a situation
drawback.eg: One of the drawbacks of living with someone is having to share a bathroom.

drawer.eng_def: a box-shaped container, without a top, that is part of a piece of furniture. It slides in and out to open and close and is used for keeping things in.
drawer.eg: I keep my socks in the bottom drawer.

drawing.eng_def: the act of making a picture with a pencil or pen, or a picture made in this way

dread.eng_def: to feel extremely worried or frightened about something that is going to happen or that might happen
dread.eg: He's dreading the exam - he's sure he's going to fail.

dread.eng_def: used to say that you do not want to think about something because it is too worrying
dread.eg: I dread to think what would happen if he was left to cope on his own.

dread.eng_def: a strong feeling of fear or worry
dread.eg: The prospect of working full-time fills me with dread.

dreadful.eng_def: very bad, of very low quality, or shocking and very sad
dreadful.eg: The food was bad and the service was dreadful.

dream.eng_def: a series of events or images that happen in your mind when you are sleeping
something that you want to happen very much but that is not very likely
dream.eg: It's always been my dream to have flying lessons.

dream.eng_def: the best that you can imagine
dream.eg: Win the house of your dreams in our fantastic competition!

dream.eng_def: the perfect house, job, etc., that you want more than any other
to experience events and images in your mind while you are sleeping
dream.eg: What did you dream about last night?

dream.eng_def: to imagine that you have heard, done, or seen something when you have not
dream.eg: Did you say that you were going tonight or did I dream it?

dream.eng_def: to imagine something that you would like to happen
dream.eg: I dream of living on a tropical island.

dream.eng_def: used to tell someone that what they are hoping for is not likely to happen or to be true
dream.eg: "Watch. All I have to do is wink at her, and she'll come over here." "Dream on, Dave!"

dreary.eng_def: boring and making you feel unhappy
dreary.chi_def: 沈悶的，單調乏味的，令人沮喪的

dress.eng_def: a piece of clothing for women or girls that covers the top half of the body and hangs down over the legs
used, especially in combination, to refer to clothes of a particular type, especially those worn in particular situations
dress.chi_def: （尤指適用於某種場合的）服裝
dress.eg: The king, in full ceremonial dress, presided over the ceremony.

dress.eng_def: to put clothes on yourself or someone else, especially a child
dress.chi_def: 穿衣服；給（尤指小孩）穿衣服
dress.eg: My husband dresses the boys while I make breakfast.

dress.eng_def: to wear a particular type of clothes
dress.eg: I have to dress in a suit and tie for work.

dress.eng_def: to put on formal clothes for a meal
dress.eg: It's the type of hotel where you're expected to dress for dinner.

dress.eng_def: to add a liquid, especially a mixture of oil and vinegar, to a salad for extra flavour
to prepare meat, chicken, fish, or crab so it can be eaten
to treat an injury by cleaning it and putting medicine or a covering on it to protect it
dress.eg: Clean and dress the wound immediately.

dress.eng_def: to decorate a shop window, usually with an arrangement of goods
dress.eg: They're dressing the store's windows for Christmas.

dress.eng_def: used to refer to men's suits, shirts, or other clothes of the type that are worn at formal occasions
dress.eg: a white dress shirt and bow tie

dresser.eng_def: a tall piece of furniture with cupboards below and shelves on the top half
a piece of bedroom furniture with drawers, sometimes with a mirror on top, used especially for keeping clothes in
dresser.chi_def: （有抽屜、頂部通常配有鏡子的）矮衣櫃

dresser.eng_def: used in phrases that describe the type of clothes that someone wears
dresser.eg: She was always a very stylish dresser.

dresser.eng_def: a person who works in the theatre or in films, helping the actors to put on their clothes

dressing.eng_def: a liquid mixture, often containing oil, vinegar, and herbs, added to food, especially salads
dressing.chi_def: 佐料，調料（常由油、醋及香草混製而成，尤用於拌沙拉）

dressing.eng_def: a covering that is put on a cut or an area of damaged skin to protect it

drift.eng_def: to move slowly, especially as a result of outside forces, with no control over direction
drift.chi_def: （尤指在外力作用下）飄，漂流，漂移
drift.eg: No one noticed that the boat had begun to drift out to sea.

drift.eng_def: the general meaning without the details
drift.eg: The general drift of the article was that society doesn't value older people.

drift.eng_def: to understand the general meaning of what someone is saying
drift.chi_def: 大致明白某人所說的話

drift.eng_def: used to say that you have left out information or your opinion from what you have just said, but that you expect the person listening still to understand it
drift.eg: She's married, but she doesn't act as if she is, if you get my drift.

drift.eng_def: a pile of snow or something similar, formed by the wind
drift.eg: The snow lay in deep drifts.

drift.eng_def: a general development or change in a situation
drift.eg: The downward drift in copper prices looks like it will continue.

drill.eng_def: a tool or machine that makes holes
an activity that practises a particular skill and often involves repeating the same thing several times, especially a military exercise intended to train soldiers
drill.eg: In some of these schools, army-style drills are used to instil a sense of discipline.

drill.eng_def: to make a hole in something using a special tool
drill.eg: Drill three holes in the wall for the screws.

drill.eng_def: to practise something, especially military exercises, or to make someone do this
drill.eg: We watched the soldiers drilling on the parade ground.

drill.eng_def: to tell someone something repeatedly to make them remember it
drill.chi_def: （爲記憶而）反覆訓練，重複灌輸
drill.eg: It was drilled into us at an early age that we should always say "please" and "thank you".

drink.eng_def: (an amount of) liquid that is taken into the body through the mouth
drink.eg: Would you like a drink of water/tea/juice?
Do we have time for a quick drink?

drink.eng_def: a party at which you have drinks, especially alcoholic drinks
to take liquid into the body through the mouth
drink.eg: He drank three glasses of water.
"Would you like a glass of wine?" "No thanks, I don't drink."

drinking.eg: I've done a lot of drinking since dad died.

drinking.eng_def: the act of taking liquid in through your mouth
drinking.eg: This water is not for drinking.

drip.eng_def: If a liquid drips, it falls in drops, or you make it fall in drops.
the sound or action of liquid falling in drops
drip.eg: All I could hear was the drip of the rain from the roof.

drip.eng_def: a method of slowly giving someone liquid medicine or food through a tube into a vein, or a piece of equipment for doing this
drip.eg: He was on a drip for three days.

drip.eng_def: a boring person without a strong character
drip.chi_def: 沒有個性的人，乏味的人
drip.eg: Her husband is such a drip.

drive.eng_def: to move or travel on land in a motor vehicle, especially as the person controlling the vehicle's movement
the crime of operating a motor vehicle after having drunk more alcohol than you are legally allowed to
drive.eg: Smith was arrested and charged with DWI.

drive.eng_def: to force someone or something to go somewhere or do something
drive.eg: They used dogs to drive the sheep into a pen.

drive.eng_def: to force someone or something into a particular state, often an unpleasant one
drive.eg: In the course of history, love has driven men and women to strange extremes.
My mother-in-law has been staying with us this past week and she's driving me crazy.

drive.eng_def: to make you very excited, especially sexually
drive.eg: When he runs his fingers through my hair, it drives me wild!

drive.eng_def: to provide the power to keep a machine working, or to make something happen
If you drive a ball, especially in golf or baseball, you hit it hard so that it travels a long way.
drive.eg: Slater drove the ball down the fairway.

drive.eng_def: used in the names of some roads, especially roads containing houses
drive.chi_def: （尤用於沿途有房屋的道路名稱）路，大道

drive.eng_def: a short private road that leads from a public road to a house or garage
a planned effort to achieve something
drive.eg: The latest promotional material is all part of a recruitment drive.

drive.eng_def: a device for storing computer information

drive.eg: It's a long drive from Auckland to Wellington.

drive.eng_def: the system used to power a vehicle
drive.eg: a car with left-hand/right-hand drive (= in which the driver sits in the seat on the left/right).

drive.eng_def: energy and determination to achieve things
drive.eg: We are looking for someone with drive and ambition.

drive.eng_def: (in sport, especially golf or baseball) a powerful hit that sends a ball a long way
drive.chi_def: （體育運動中，尤其高爾夫球或棒球的）大力擊球

driver.eng_def: a computer program that makes it possible for a computer to use other pieces of equipment such as a printer
a type of club (= a long, thin stick) with a wooden head, used in golf
driver.chi_def: （一種頭寬把長的木制）高爾夫球棒

driveway.eng_def: a a short private road that leads from a public road to a house or garage

drizzle.eng_def: rain in very small, light drops
drizzle.eg: Tomorrow will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle.

drizzle.eng_def: a small amount of liquid that is lightly poured over something
drizzle.eg: Serve the pasta with a drizzle of olive oil.

drizzle.eng_def: to pour liquid slowly over something, especially in a thin line or in small drops
drizzle.chi_def: 緩慢地傾倒，細細地滴灑
drizzle.eg: Drizzle the syrup over the warm cake.

drizzle.eng_def: to rain in small light drops

drop.eng_def: to fall or to allow something to fall

drop.eg: He dropped dead on the squash court at the age of 43.

drop.eng_def: to write someone a letter, especially a short informal one
drop.chi_def: 給…寫信（尤指非正式的簡短書信）
drop.eg: Just drop me a line when you decide on a date.

drop.eng_def: to tell someone something in a way that is not direct
drop.eg: She dropped a hint that she'd like to come to the party.

drop.eng_def: to not pronounce the letter h at the beginning of words in which it should be pronounced
to move to a lower level, or cause something to move to a lower level
drop.eg: The water level in the flooded region has finally begun to drop.

drop.eng_def: to stop doing or planning something, especially an activity
drop.chi_def: 停止，放棄（尤指某種活動）
drop.eg: I'm going to drop yoga and do aerobics instead.

drop.eng_def: to stop including someone in a group or team
drop.chi_def: 將…排除在外；開除；使離隊
drop.eg: He's been dropped from the team because of injury.

drop.eng_def: to take someone to a particular place, usually in a car, and leave them there
drop.chi_def: （通常指用汽車）帶，捎（某人至某地）
drop.eg: They dropped me off at the main entrance.

drop.eng_def: a small round-shaped amount of liquid
drop.eg: I thought I felt a drop of rain.

drop.eng_def: a small amount of liquid you can drink
drop.eg: I'll have a drop more juice, please.

drop.eng_def: liquid medicine given in very small amounts
a small piece of sweet food made of sugar
the distance from one thing to something lower
drop.eg: There's a drop of two metres from the window to the ground.

drop.eng_def: a reduction in the amount or level of something
drop.chi_def: 降低的程度；減少的數量
drop.eg: The recent drop in magazine subscriptions is causing some concern.

drop.eng_def: the act of delivering things such as supplies, medicine, etc., often by dropping them from an aircraft
the situation in which something is left in a place and later collected by someone else, usually a spy

drought.eng_def: a long period when there is little or no rain
drought.eg: This year (a) severe drought has ruined the crops.

drown.eng_def: to (cause to) die by being unable to breathe underwater
drown.eg: He drowned in a boating accident.

drown.eng_def: to cover or be covered, especially with a liquid
drown.eg: A whole valley was drowned when the river was dammed.

drowsy.eng_def: being in a state between sleeping and being awake
drowsy.chi_def: 睡意朦朧的，半夢半醒的，似睡非睡的
drowsy.eg: The room is so warm it's making me feel drowsy.

drug.eng_def: any natural or artificially made chemical that is used as a medicine
any natural or artificially made chemical that is taken for pleasure, to improve someone's performance of an activity, or because a person cannot stop using it
any activity that you cannot stop doing
drug.eg: Work is a drug for him.

drug.eng_def: to give a person or animal a chemical that causes him, her, or it to lose feeling or become unconscious
drug.chi_def: 用藥麻醉，對…施用麻醉劑
drug.eg: The killer confessed that he often drugged his victims before he killed them.

drugstore.eng_def: a shop where you can buy medicines, make-up, and other things such as chocolate

drum.eng_def: a musical instrument, especially one made from a skin stretched over the end of a hollow tube or bowl, played by hitting with the hand or a stick
the hollow metal cylinder in a washing machine into which clothes and other things are put for washing
to hit a surface regularly and make a sound like a drum, or to make something do this
drum.eg: She drummed her fingers impatiently on the table.

drunk.eng_def: unable to speak or act in the usual way because of having had too much alcohol
drunk.eg: I got completely drunk at my sister's wedding.

drunk.eng_def: the crime of behaving badly in public after drinking too much alcohol
having a strong and unreasonable feeling of being able to control other people
a person who drinks large amounts of alcohol very often and is unable to stop

dry.eng_def: used to describe something that has no water or other liquid in, on, or around it
dry.eg: I hung his wet trousers on the radiator, but they're not dry yet.

dry.eng_def: If a river or other area of water runs dry, the water gradually disappears from it.
dry.eg: By this time all the wells had run dry.

dry.eng_def: Dry hair or skin does not have enough of the natural oils that make it soft and smooth.
Dry bread is plain, without butter, jam, etc.
dry.eg: All I was offered was a piece of dry bread and an apple!

dry.eng_def: If a book, talk, subject, etc. is dry, it is not interesting.
If wine or other alcoholic drinks are dry, they do not taste sweet.
dry.chi_def: （葡萄酒等酒精飲料）無甜味的，乾的

dry.eng_def: Dry humour is very funny in a way that is clever and not obvious.
dry.chi_def: 不形於色的，不露聲色的

dry.eng_def: a place where the conditions are not wet, especially when compared to somewhere where the conditions are wet
dry.chi_def: 乾爽的地方，乾燥的地方
dry.eg: You're soaked - come into the dry.

dry.eng_def: to become dry, or to make something become dry
dry.eg: Will this paint dry by tomorrow?

dry.eng_def: to dry plates, knives, forks, etc. after they have been washed

dryer.eng_def: a machine that dries wet clothes by turning them in hot air

dual.eng_def: with two parts, or combining two things
dual.chi_def: 兩部分的；二元的；雙重的
dual.eg: This room has a dual purpose, serving as both a study and a dining room.

dual.eng_def: two sets of controls in a car, one for the person who is learning to drive and one for the teacher
dual.chi_def: （教練汽車的）雙重控制，複式操縱

dual.eng_def: the nationality of two countries at the same time
dual.eg: She has dual British and American nationality.

dubious.eng_def: thought not to be completely true or not able to be trusted
dubious.chi_def: 半信半疑的，可疑的；不確定的；不可信的
dubious.eg: These claims are dubious and not scientifically proven.

dubious.eng_def: feeling doubt or not feeling certain
dubious.eg: I'm dubious about his promises to change his ways.

duck.eng_def: a bird that lives by water and has webbed feet (= feet with skin between the toes), a short neck, and a large beak
a friendly way of talking to someone you like
duck.eg: Come and sit beside me, duck.

duck.eng_def: to move your head or the top part of your body quickly down, especially to avoid being hit
duck.chi_def: （尤指爲避免被擊中而）猛低頭，猛彎腰
duck.eg: I saw the ball hurtling towards me and ducked (down).

duck.eng_def: to push someone underwater for a short time
duck.eg: The boys were splashing around and ducking each other in the pool.

duck.eng_def: to move quickly to a place, especially in order not to be seen
duck.chi_def: （尤指爲了避免被發現而）趕忙躲藏起來
duck.eg: When he saw them coming, he ducked into a doorway.

duckling.eng_def: a young duck, or its flesh when used as food

due.eng_def: expected to happen, arrive, etc. at a particular time
due.eg: What time is the next bus due?

due.eng_def: at a suitable time in the future
due.chi_def: 在（將來）適當的時候，到時候
due.eg: You will receive notification of the results in due course.
A lot of her unhappiness is due to boredom.

due.eng_def: owed as a debt or as a right
due.chi_def: 欠債的，應支付的；應給的
due.eg: The rent is due (= should be paid) at the end of the month.

due.eng_def: If you are due for something, you expect to receive it, because you deserve it.
due.eg: I'm due for a promotion soon.

due.eng_def: said when you are praising someone for something good they have done, although you dislike other things about them
due.chi_def: 說句公道話，實事求是地講
due.eg: He failed again, but to give him his due, he did try hard.

due.eng_def: the official payments that you make to an organization you belong to
due.eg: Members of the society pay $1,000 in annual dues.

due.eng_def: in a direction that is straight towards the north, south, east, or west
due.chi_def: 正向，正對著（東、南、西或北）
due.eg: From here, you go due east until you get to the Interstate.

dull.eng_def: not interesting or exciting in any way
dull.eg: She wrote dull, respectable articles for the local newspaper.
We could just see a dull glow given off by the fire's last embers.

dull.eng_def: A dull sound or pain is not sharp or clear.
dull.eg: I heard a dull thud from the kitchen and realized she must have fainted.
Homeless children sniff glue to dull their hunger pains.

dumb.eng_def: permanently or temporarily unable to speak
dumb.eg: He's been deaf and dumb since birth.
Are they brave or just dumb?

dump.eng_def: to put down or drop something in a careless way
dump.eg: He came in with four shopping bags and dumped them on the table.

dump.eng_def: to get rid of something unwanted, especially by leaving it in a place where it is not allowed to be
dump.eg: The tax was so unpopular that the government decided to dump it.

dump.eng_def: to sell unwanted goods very cheaply, usually in other countries
dump.eg: They accused the West of dumping out-of-date medicines on Third World countries.

dump.eng_def: to move information from a computer's memory to another place or device
to suddenly end a romantic relationship you have been having with someone
dump.eg: If he's so awful, why don't you just dump him?

dump.eng_def: a place where people are allowed to leave their rubbish
dump.eg: I'm going to clean out the basement and take everything I don't want to the dump.

dump.eng_def: a very unpleasant and unattractive place
dump.chi_def: 淩亂的地方，令人厭惡的地方
dump.eg: This town is a complete dump!

dump.eng_def: a place where things of a particular type are stored, especially by an army
dump.chi_def: 專用倉庫；（尤指）軍需品存放處

dump.eng_def: an act of moving information from a computer's memory to another place or device

dumpling.eng_def: a small ball of dough (= flour and water mixed together), cooked, and eaten with meat and vegetables
a small amount of fruit covered in a sweet dough and baked

durable.eng_def: able to last a long time without becoming damaged
durable.eg: The machines have to be made of durable materials.

duration.eng_def: the length of time that something lasts
duration.eg: He planned a stay of two years' duration.

duration.eng_def: for as long as something lasts
duration.eg: I guess we're stuck with each other for the duration (of the journey).

during.eng_def: from the beginning to the end of a particular period
during.eg: They work during the night and sleep by day.

during.eng_def: at some time between the beginning and the end of a period
during.eg: I woke up several times during the night.

dusk.eng_def: the time before night when it is not yet dark
dusk.eg: As dusk fell, bats began to fly between the trees.

dust.eng_def: dry dirt in the form of powder that covers surfaces inside a building, or very small dry pieces of soil, sand, or other substances
dust.eg: The furniture was covered in dust and cobwebs.

dust.eng_def: to use a cloth to remove dust from the surface of something
dust.eg: I was dusting the mantelpiece when I noticed a crack.

dust.eng_def: to cover something with a light powder
dust.eg: Dust the top of the cake with icing sugar.

dusty.eg: Piles of dusty books lay on the floor.

duty.eng_def: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
duty.eg: The duty of the agency is to act in the best interests of the child.

duty.eng_def: to have to do something because it is your duty
duty.eg: We are duty bound to justify how we spend our funds.

duty.eng_def: a tax paid to the government, especially on things that you bring into a country
duty.eg: There's a high duty on alcohol.

dwarf.eng_def: in stories for children, a creature like a little man with magical powers
dwarf.chi_def: （兒童故事裡有魔法的）小矮人
dwarf.eg: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

dwarf.eng_def: a person who is much smaller than the usual size

dwarf.eg: You can grow dwarf conifers in pots on the patio.

dwarf.eng_def: If one thing dwarfs another, it makes it seem small by comparison.
dwarf.chi_def: 使…相形見絀；使…顯得矮小
dwarf.eg: The new skyscraper will dwarf all those near it.

dwell.eng_def: to live in a place or in a particular way
dwell.eg: She dwelt in remote parts of Asia for many years.

dwelling.eng_def: a house or place to live in
dwelling.eg: There is an estimated shortfall of some five million dwellings across the country.

dye.eng_def: to change the colour of something using a special liquid
dye.eg: For a change, why not dye your T-shirts?

dye.eng_def: a substance used to change the colour of something
dye.eg: She dipped the material into the dye.

dynamic.eng_def: having a lot of ideas and enthusiasm
dynamic.chi_def: 思維活躍的；活潑的，充滿活力的，精力充沛的
dynamic.eg: She's young and dynamic and will be a great addition to the team.

dynamic.chi_def: 不斷變化的；不斷發展的
dynamic.eg: Business innovation is a dynamic process.

dynamic.eng_def: relating to forces that produce movement

dynamite.chi_def: 黃色炸藥，達納炸藥，甘油炸藥

dynamite.eng_def: something that causes or may cause great shock or excitement
dynamite.chi_def: 令人震驚的事件，使人激動的事情
dynamite.eg: The issue of unemployment is political dynamite (= could cause big political problems).
The rebels had dynamited the railway line.

dynasty.eng_def: a series of rulers or leaders who are all from the same family, or a period when a country is ruled by them
dynasty.eg: The Mogul dynasty ruled over India for centuries.

e-mail.eng_def: the system for using computers to send messages over the internet
e-mail.eg: You can contact us by email or fax.

e-mail.eng_def: a message or document sent using this system
e-mail.eg: I got an email from Danielle last week.

e-mail.eng_def: to send an email to someone
e-mail.eg: Email me when you've got time.

each.eng_def: every thing, person, etc. in a group of two or more, considered separately
each.chi_def: （兩個或兩個以上物或人中的）每個，各，各自
each.eg: When you run, each foot leaves the ground before the other comes down.

each.eng_def: used to say that everyone likes different things
each.chi_def: （用來表示人各有不同的愛好）人各不同；各有所好
each.eg: You actually like modern jazz, do you? Each to their own.

each.eng_def: If you put an amount of money each way on a horse race, you will win money if the horse you have chosen comes first, second, or third.
each.chi_def: （下注的馬得前三名即贏的）一注三贏

eager.eng_def: wanting very much to do or have something, especially something interesting or enjoyable

eagle.eng_def: a large, strong bird with a curved beak that eats meat and can see very well

ear.eng_def: either of the two organs, one on each side of the head, by which people or animals hear sounds, or the piece of skin and tissue outside the head connected to this organ
ear.eg: The hearing in my left ear's not so good.

ear.eng_def: the flower part of a plant like a grass, such as wheat, that later contains the grains that are used as food

early.eng_def: near the beginning of a period of time, or before the usual, expected, or planned time
early.chi_def: 早期的，初期的；在早期，在初期；提早（的），提前（的）
early.eg: If you finish early you can go home.

early.eng_def: Early flowers and vegetables are ones that are ready early in the year, before most other ones.
early.chi_def: 早開的(花卉)；早熟的（蔬菜）

early.eng_def: used after a date or time to show that something will not happen before then
early.eg: I'm very busy, so I won't be with you till four o'clock at the earliest.

earn.eng_def: to receive money as payment for work that you do
to get something that you deserve
earn.eg: It's been a tough six months and I feel I've earned a few weeks off.

earnest.eng_def: serious and determined, especially too serious and unable to find your own actions funny
earnest.chi_def: 認真的；有決心的；鄭重其事的；誠摯的
earnest.eg: He was a very earnest young man.
These fanatics are in deadly earnest when they say they want to destroy all forms of government.

earnest.eng_def: When something begins in earnest, it has already started but is now being done in a serious and complete way.
earnest.eg: The election campaign has begun in earnest.
I thought he was joking - I didn't realize he was in earnest.

earnings.eng_def: the amount of money that someone is paid for working
earnings.eg: Average earnings for skilled workers are rising.

earnings.eng_def: a company's profits in a particular period
earnings.eg: Sun Microsystems reported earnings that were slightly better than the market had been expecting.

earth.eng_def: the planet third in order of distance from the sun, between Venus and Mars; the world on which we live
earth.eg: The earth takes approximately 3651/4 days to go round the sun.

earth.eng_def: the land surface of the world rather than the sky or sea
earth.eg: The earth was shaking and people rushed out of their houses in panic.

earth.eng_def: the usually brown, heavy and loose substance of which a large part of the surface of the ground is made, and in which plants can grow
earth.eg: The ploughed earth looked rich and dark and fertile.

earth.eng_def: a wire that makes a connection between a piece of electrical equipment and the ground, so the user is protected from feeling an electric shock if the equipment develops a fault
a hole in the ground where an animal such as a fox lives
to put an earth (= wire) between a piece of electrical equipment and the ground
earth.eg: You could get a nasty shock from that water heater if it isn't earthed properly.

earthquake.eng_def: a sudden violent movement of the earth's surface, sometimes causing great damage
earthquake.eg: In 1906 an earthquake destroyed much of San Francisco.

ease.eng_def: to make or become less severe, difficult, unpleasant, painful, etc.
ease.eg: To ease the problem of overcrowding, new prisons will be built.

ease.eng_def: to move or to make something move slowly and carefully in a particular direction or into a particular position
ease.chi_def: （使）小心緩慢地移動；（使）緩緩移動
ease.eg: She eased the key into the lock, anxious not to wake anyone.

ease.eng_def: the state of experiencing no difficulty, effort, pain, etc.
ease.chi_def: 容易，不費力；舒適，安逸，自在
ease.eg: She won the 400 metre race with ease.

ease.eng_def: If someone, especially a soldier, is at ease, they are standing with their feet apart and their hands behind their back.

east.eng_def: the direction from which the sun rises in the morning, opposite to the west, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction
east.eg: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.

east.eng_def: Asia, especially its eastern and southern parts
east.chi_def: （尤指亞洲東部和南部地區）亞洲國家，東方國家
east.eg: She spent her childhood in the East - mostly in China.

east.eng_def: those countries in Europe that had communist governments before the 1990s
east.chi_def: （20世紀90年代前的）東歐共産主義國家，東方集團
east.eg: The collapse of Communism changed East-West relations for ever.

east.eng_def: in or forming the east part of something
a wind coming from the east

east.eg: We'll drive east for a few more miles, then turn south.

eastern.eng_def: in or from the east part of an area
eastern.chi_def: （某個地區的）東部的；來自東部的
eastern.eg: The eastern part of the country is very mountainous.

easy.eng_def: comfortable or calm; free from worry, pain, etc.
easy.eg: They both retired and went off to lead an easy life in the Bahamas.

eat.eng_def: to put or take food into the mouth, chew it (= crush it with the teeth), and swallow it

ebb.eng_def: When the sea or tide ebbs, it moves away from the coast and falls to a lower level.
If a physical or emotional feeling ebbs, it becomes less strong or disappears.
ebb.eg: He could feel his strength ebbing (away).

ebb.eng_def: the tide when it is moving away from the coast

eccentric.eng_def: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humorous way
eccentric.chi_def: 怪異的，古怪的；異乎尋常的

eccentric.eng_def: someone who behaves in an eccentric way
eccentric.eg: My mother is something of an eccentric.

echo.eng_def: a sound that is heard after it has been reflected off a surface such as a wall or a cliff
echo.eg: The echoes of his scream sounded in the cave for several seconds.

echo.eng_def: a detail that is similar to and makes you remember something else
echo.chi_def: 十分相似的東西；如出一轍的事物；仿效
echo.eg: There are echoes of Mozart in her first piano compositions.

echo.eng_def: If a sound echoes or a place echoes with a sound, you hear the sound again because you are in a large, empty space.
echo.chi_def: 回響；發出回聲；響起回聲
echo.eg: The sound of footsteps echoed around the hall.

echo.eng_def: to repeat details that are similar to, and make you think of, something else
echo.chi_def: 重複，附和；使産生似曾相識的感覺
echo.eg: The design of the church echoes that of St. Paul's Cathedral.

eclipse.eng_def: an occasion when the sun disappears from view, either completely or partly, while the moon is moving between it and the earth, or when the moon becomes darker while the shadow of the earth moves over it
a situation in which something becomes less important
eclipse.eg: The eclipse of the ruling political party was inevitable.

eclipse.eng_def: to make an eclipse of the moon or sun
eclipse.eg: The moon will be totally eclipsed at 12.10 p.m.

eclipse.eng_def: to make another person or thing seem much less important, good, or famous
eclipse.chi_def: 掩沒…的重要性（或優點、聲譽等）；淩駕…之上；光芒蓋過…
eclipse.eg: The economy has eclipsed all other issues during this election campaign.

ecology.eng_def: the relationships between the air, land, water, animals, plants, etc., usually of a particular area, or the scientific study of this
ecology.chi_def: （通常指一個特定區域的）生態；生態學
ecology.eg: The oil spill caused terrible damage to the fragile ecology of the coast.

economic.eng_def: relating to trade, industry, and money
economic.eg: The country has been in a very poor economic state ever since the decline of its two major industries.

economic.eng_def: making a profit, or likely to make a profit
economic.chi_def: 産生經濟效益的；有利可圖的；能賺錢的
economic.eg: We had to close our London office - with the rent so high it just wasn't economic.

economical.eng_def: not using a lot of fuel, money, etc.
economical.eg: There's increasing demand for cars that are more economical on fuel.

economics.eng_def: the way in which trade, industry, or money is organized, or the study of this
economics.chi_def: 經濟狀況；經濟因素；經濟學
economics.eg: Their ideas sound fine in principle, but they haven't worked out the economics behind the policies.

economist.eng_def: a person who studies or has a special knowledge of economics

economy.eng_def: the system of trade and industry by which the wealth of a country is made and used
the intentional saving of money or, less commonly, the saving of time, energy, words, etc.
economy.eg: They've had to make economies since Nathan lost his job.

ecstasy.eng_def: a state of extreme happiness, especially when feeling pleasure
ecstasy.eg: She threw her head back as if in ecstasy.

ecstasy.eng_def: a powerful drug that makes you feel very active and can cause you to hallucinate (= see or hear things that do not exist)

edge.eng_def: the outer or furthest point of something
edge.eg: He put pink icing around the edge of the cake.

edge.eng_def: the side of a blade that cuts, or any sharp part of an object that could cut
edge.eg: Careful with that open can - it's got a very sharp edge.

edge.eng_def: the point just before something very different and noticeable happens
edge.eg: The company is on the edge of collapse.

edge.eng_def: If an unpleasant event pushes someone over the edge, it makes them start to behave in a crazy way.
edge.eg: She had been driven over the edge by the separation from her husband.
In terms of experience, she definitely had the edge over the other people that we interviewed.

edge.eng_def: a small but noticeable amount of anger in someone's voice
edge.chi_def: 尖刻的聲調；厭煩的聲調；憤怒的語氣
edge.eg: There's a definite edge to/in her voice when she talks to her husband.

edge.chi_def: 如坐針氈的；惴惴不安的；煩躁的
edge.eg: Is something wrong? You seem a bit on edge this morning.

edge.eng_def: to move slowly with gradual movements or in gradual stages, or to make someone or something move in this way
edge.eg: A long line of traffic edged its way forward.

edible.chi_def: （無毒而）可以吃的；適宜食用的
edible.eg: Only the leaves of the plant are edible.

edit.eng_def: to make changes to a text or film, deciding what will be removed and what will be kept in, in order to prepare it for being printed or shown
edit.eg: Janet edited books for a variety of publishers.

edit.eng_def: to be in charge of the reports in a newspaper or magazine, etc.

edition.eng_def: a particular form in which a book, magazine, or newspaper is published
edition.eg: the paperback/hardback edition of the dictionary

edition.eng_def: a single broadcast of a series of radio or television programmes
edition.eg: This morning's edition of 'Women's Hour' is at the earlier time of a quarter to ten.

edition.eng_def: the total number of copies of a particular book, newspaper, etc. that are published at the same time
edition.eg: She collects first editions of 19th-century authors.

edition.eng_def: one of a series of repeated events
edition.chi_def: （一系列重複進行的事件中的）一次，一回，一屆
edition.eg: The 77th edition of the Indianapolis 500 was held before an estimated 450,000 fans.

editor.eng_def: a person who corrects or changes pieces of text or films before they are printed or shown, or a person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine
editor.chi_def: （書的）編輯；（電影電視的）剪輯員；（報刊的）主編
editor.eg: She's a senior editor in the reference department of a publishing company.

editorial.eng_def: an article in a newspaper that expresses the editor's opinion on a subject of particular interest at the present time
editorial.eg: All the papers deal with the same subject in their editorials.

editorial.eng_def: relating to editors or editing, or to the editor of a newspaper or magazine

educate.eng_def: to teach someone, especially using the formal system of school, college, or university
educate.chi_def: （尤指透過正規學校體系）教育，培養
educate.eg: The form says he was educated in Africa.

education.eng_def: the process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this
education.chi_def: 教育；受教育獲得的知識
education.eg: As a child he received most of his education at home.

educational.eng_def: providing education or relating to education
educational.eg: Reducing the size of classes may improve educational standards.

eel.eng_def: a long, thin, snake-like fish, some types of which are eaten

effect.eng_def: the result of a particular influence
effect.eg: The radiation leak has had a disastrous effect on/upon the environment.

effect.eng_def: to produce or achieve the results you want
effect.eg: They had to wait ten minutes for the anaesthetic to take effect before they stitched up the cut.

effect.eng_def: If you say or do something for effect, you intentionally do it to shock people or attract their attention.
effect.eg: I get the impression that she uses bad language in meetings for effect.
So in effect the government have lowered taxes for the rich and raised them for the poor.

effect.eng_def: used to express that what you are reporting is only a short and general form of what was really said
effect.chi_def: 有…的意思；大意是…，意思是…
effect.eg: She said she was unhappy, or words to that effect.
The present system of payment will remain in effect (= be used) until the end of the rental agreement.

effect.eng_def: lighting, sounds, and objects that are specially produced for the stage or a film and are intended to make something that does not exist seem real
effect.eg: This is a movie worth seeing for its effects alone.

effect.eng_def: a person's possessions, especially after their death
effect.chi_def: （尤指死後遺留的）財産，財物，所有物
effect.eg: It says on the form that the insurance covers all personal effects.

effect.eng_def: to achieve something and cause it to happen
effect.eg: As a political party they are trying to effect a change in the way that we think about our environment.

effective.eng_def: successful or achieving the results that you want
effective.chi_def: 能産生預期結果的；有效的
effective.eg: It's an extremely effective cure for a headache.
Although she's not officially our boss, she's in effective control of the office.

effective.eng_def: If a law or rule becomes effective, it starts to be used.
effective.eg: The new laws will become effective next month.

efficiency.eng_def: the good use of time and energy in a way that does not waste any
efficiency.eg: What is so impressive about their society is the efficiency of the public services.

efficiency.eng_def: the difference between the amount of energy that is put into a machine in the form of fuel, effort, etc. and the amount that comes out of it in the form of movement

efficient.eng_def: working or operating quickly and effectively in an organized way
efficient.chi_def: 效率高的；有能力的；有效的；生效的
efficient.eg: The city's transport system is one of the most efficient in Europe.

effort.eng_def: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something
effort.eg: If we could all make an effort to keep this office tidier it would help.

effort.eng_def: the result of an attempt to produce something, especially when its quality is low or uncertain
effort.chi_def: （尤指不理想的或難以確定的）結果
effort.eg: Do you want to have a look at his exam paper? It's a fairly poor effort.

effort.eng_def: to be difficult, tiring, or boring to do
effort.eg: I'm exhausted all the time, and everything is a real effort.

egg.eng_def: the oval object with a hard shell that is produced by female birds, especially chickens, eaten as food
an object that is made in the shape of a bird's egg
an oval object, often with a hard shell, that is produced by female birds and particular reptiles and insects, and contains a baby animal that comes out when it is developed
egg.eg: The cuckoo lays her egg in another bird's nest.

egg.eng_def: a cell produced by a woman or female animal from which a baby can develop if it combines with a male sex cell
egg.eg: Identical twins develop from a single fertilized egg that then splits into two.

ego.eng_def: your idea or opinion of yourself, especially your feeling of your own importance and ability
ego.chi_def: 自我評價；自我中心；自負；自尊心
ego.eg: That man has such an enormous ego - I've never known anyone so full of themselves!

ego.eng_def: in psychoanalysis, the part of a person's mind that tries to match the hidden desires (= wishes) of the id (= part of the unconscious mind) with the demands of the real world

eight.eg: She was eight (years old) when her family moved here.

eighteen.eg: You are allowed to vote at eighteen (= when you are 18 years old)

either.eng_def: used in negative sentences instead of "also" or "too"
either.eg: I don't eat meat and my husband doesn't either.

either.eng_def: used when referring to a choice between two possibilities
either.chi_def: （兩種可能性的選擇）要麽…要麽，不是…就是，或者…或者；（兩者中）任何一個
either.eg: Either candidate would be ideal for the job.
Unfortunately I was sitting at the table with smokers on either side of me.

elaborate.eng_def: containing a lot of careful detail or many detailed parts
elaborate.chi_def: 精心計劃（或製作）的；詳盡的；複雜的
elaborate.eg: You want a plain blouse to go with that skirt - nothing too elaborate.

elaborate.eng_def: to add more information to or explain something that you have said
elaborate.eg: The congresswoman said she was resigning, but refused to elaborate on her reasons for doing so.

elastic.eng_def: An elastic material is able to stretch and be returned to its original shape or size.
elastic.eg: A lot of sportswear is made of very elastic material.

elastic.eng_def: able or likely to be changed
elastic.eg: The project has only just started so any plans are still very elastic.

elastic.eng_def: a type of rubber that is able to stretch and be returned to its original shape or size
elastic.eg: His trousers were held up with a piece of elastic.

elbow.eng_def: the part in the middle of the arm where it bends, or the part of a piece of clothing that covers this area
elbow.eg: Her arm was bandaged from the elbow to the fingers.

elbow.eng_def: to push someone rudely with your elbows so that you can move or have more space
elbow.eg: He elbowed his way to the front of the crowd.

elbow.eng_def: to hit someone with your elbow, sometimes as a sign to make them notice or remember something
elbow.chi_def: （爲讓某人注意或提醒某事而）用肘碰
elbow.eg: She elbowed me in the ribs before I could say anything.

elder.eng_def: an older person, especially one with a respected position in society
elder.chi_def: （尤指在社會上地位高、受人尊敬的）長者，長輩，老年人
elder.eg: You should listen to the advice of your elders.

elder.eng_def: an official of a religious group
a sister/brother/son/daughter who is older than the other sister(s), brother(s), etc.
elder.chi_def: 姐姐／ 哥哥／ 大兒子／ 大女兒

elder.eng_def: the older person of two people
elder.eg: Of the two brothers Harvey is the elder.

elder.eng_def: used after someone's name to show that they are the older of two people who have the same name, especially a father and son
elder.chi_def: （用於人名後表示兩個同名者、尤指兩父子中的父親）大，老

elderly.chi_def: （帶有敬意）年老的；上了年紀的；年紀較大的

elderly.eng_def: old people considered as a group
elderly.eg: The city is building new housing for the elderly.

elect.eng_def: to decide on or choose, especially to choose a person for a particular job, by voting
elect.eg: The President is elected for a four-year term of office.

elect.eng_def: to choose to do a particular thing
elect.eg: She elected to take early retirement instead of moving to the new location.

elect.eng_def: in the Bible, people who are chosen by God
any group of people who have been specially chosen for their particular qualities
the person who has been voted to be president, prime minister, etc. but has not yet started work
elect.eg: The president elect has been preparing to take office in January.

election.eng_def: a time when people vote in order to choose someone for a political or official job
election.eg: The government is expected to call an election (= allow the country to vote) very soon.

electric.eg: Our electric bill for July was $115.

electric.eng_def: very exciting and producing strong feelings
electric.chi_def: 令人激動的，令人興奮的；高度刺激的

electric.eg: How much do you pay for gas and electric?

electrician.eng_def: a person who puts in, checks, and repairs electrical wires and electrical equipment

electricity.eng_def: a form of energy that can be produced in several ways and that provides power to devices that create light, heat, etc.
electricity.eg: The electricity has been turned off.

electron.eng_def: an extremely small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge

electronic.eng_def: (especially of equipment), using, based on, or used in a system of operation that involves the control of electric current by various devices
electronic.chi_def: （尤指設備）使用電子器件的，電子的

electronic.eng_def: relating to computers or something that is done by computers

electronics.eng_def: the scientific study of electric current and the technology that uses it

elegant.eng_def: graceful and attractive in appearance or behaviour
An elegant idea, plan, or solution is clever but simple, and therefore attractive.
elegant.chi_def: （想法、計劃或辦法）巧妙的，簡捷的，簡練的

element.eg: List the elements that make up a perfect dinner party.

element.eng_def: a small amount of an emotion or quality
element.eg: There was certainly an element of truth in what she said.

element.eng_def: a simple substance that cannot be reduced to smaller chemical parts
earth, air, fire, and water from which people in the past believed everything else was made
element.chi_def: 四大元素（舊時人們認爲構成一切事物的土、風、火、水）

element.eg: We decided to brave the elements and go for a walk (= go for a walk despite the bad weather).

element.eng_def: the part of an electrical device that produces heat
a circular piece of material often made of metal that can be heated in order to be used for cooking

elementary.eg: I have an elementary knowledge of physics.

elementary.eng_def: relating to the early stages of studying a subject
elementary.eg: This book contains a series of elementary exercises for learners.

elephant.eng_def: a very large grey mammal that has a trunk (= long nose) with which it can pick things up

elevate.eng_def: to raise something or lift something up
elevate.eg: The platform was elevated by means of hydraulic legs.

elevate.eng_def: to make someone or something more important or to improve something
elevate.eg: They want to elevate the status of teachers.

elevate.eng_def: to be given a higher rank or social position
elevate.eg: He has been elevated to deputy manager.

elevator.eng_def: a device like a box that moves up and down, carrying people or goods from one floor of a building to another or taking people up and down underground in a mine
a conveyor (= moving strip) that can be used for removing goods from a ship, putting bags onto an aircraft, moving grain, etc.
elevator.chi_def: （裝有傳送帶，用以卸貨、裝貨或搬運糧食入庫的）升降機，起卸機

eleven.eg: There are eleven girls in my class and ten boys.

eligible.eng_def: having the necessary qualities or satisfying the necessary conditions
eligible.chi_def: 具備條件的；有資格的；合格的
eligible.eg: Are you eligible for early retirement/maternity leave?

eligible.eng_def: An eligible person is not married and is thought to be a suitable future marriage partner, especially because they are rich and attractive.
eligible.chi_def: （作爲結婚對象）理想的，合適的
eligible.eg: I can think of several eligible bachelors of my acquaintance.

eliminate.eng_def: to remove or take away someone or something
eliminate.eg: A move towards healthy eating could help eliminate heart disease.

eliminate.eng_def: to defeat someone so that they cannot continue in a competition
eliminate.eg: He was eliminated in the third round of the competition.
A police officer was accused of helping a drug gang eliminate rivals.

elite.eng_def: the richest, most powerful, best-educated, or best-trained group in a society
elite.chi_def: （社會）上層集團；掌權人物；出類拔萃的人，精英

elite.eng_def: belonging to the richest, most powerful, best-educated, or best-trained group in a society
elite.chi_def: （社會）上層集團的；掌權人物的；精英的
elite.eg: Elite troops were airlifted to the trouble zone.

eloquent.eg: She made an eloquent appeal for action.

else.eng_def: used after words beginning with any-, every-, no-, and some-, or after how, what, where, who, why, but not which, to mean 'other', 'another', 'different', 'extra'
else.chi_def: （用於以 any-，every-，no- 和 some- 開頭的詞後面，或用於 how，what，where，who，why 之後，但不用於 which 之後）其他，另外，別的
else.eg: Everybody else has (= all the other people have) agreed except for you.

elsewhere.eng_def: at, in, from, or to another place or other places; anywhere or somewhere else
elsewhere.eg: The report looks at economic growth in Europe and elsewhere.

email.eng_def: the system for using computers to send messages over the internet
email.eg: You can contact us by email or fax.

email.eng_def: a message or document sent using this system
email.eg: I got an email from Danielle last week.

email.eng_def: to send an email to someone
email.eg: Email me when you've got time.

embark.eg: We embarked at Liverpool for New York.

embarrass.eng_def: to cause someone to feel nervous, worried, or uncomfortable
embarrass.eg: You're embarrassing him with your compliments!
